definition: variant of 毀|毁[hui3]/to destroy by fire/a blaze
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
to blow up/to destroy with explosives
to burn down/to destroy with fire/trad. also written 焚毀

sentences.english: Note that the term “meltdown” has a vague definition.
sentences.chinese: 需要注意的是，“熔燬”這個詞定義含糊不清。

sentences.english: One of the two nuclear plants in Fukushima Prefecture where partial meltdowns have taken place.
sentences.chinese: 福島的兩個可能發生熔燬的核工廠之一。

sentences.english: Especially in light of Fukushima, this is a reactor that doesn’t melt down.” —Juli Berwald
sentences.chinese: 特別鑑於福島事件，這是一個不會熔燬的反應堆。

sentences.english: Experts have not ruled out the possibility of a complete meltdown.
sentences.chinese: 專家們還沒有排除反應爐核心完全熔燬的可能性。

sentences.english: How much time is there before a meltdown?
sentences.chinese: 那在覈心熔燬之前有多少時間？

sentences.english: If the rods get too hot, they can eventually melt, thus the term "meltdown."
sentences.chinese: 如果太熱，棒條就會熔化，即“熔燬”這個專業名詞。

sentences.english: Especially in light of Fukushima, this is a reactor that doesn't melt down.
sentences.chinese: 特別鑑於福島事件，這是一個不會熔燬的反應堆。

definition: to carry on/to succeed (of a familial line)/to inherit
(archaic) to present/to bequeath/variant of 貽|贻[yi2]
